question:
For every positive integer $n$, let $\text{mod}_5 (n)$ be the remainder obtained when $n$ is divided by 5. Define a function $f: \{0,1,2,3,\dots\} \times \{0,1,2,3,4\} \to \{0,1,2,3,4\}$ recursively as follows:

\[f(i,j) = \begin{cases}\text{mod}_5 (j+1) & \text{ if } i = 0 \text{ and } 0 \le j \le 4 \text{,}\\ f(i-1,1) & \text{ if } i \ge 1 \text{ and } j = 0 \text{, and} \\ f(i-1, f(i,j-1)) & \text{ if } i \ge 1 \text{ and } 1 \le j \le 4. \end{cases}\]What is $f(2015,2)$?

logical_conclusion: Step 1: Establish the base values using f(0, j) = mod5(j+1), so f(0,0)=1, f(0,1)=2, f(0,2)=3, f(0,3)=4, f(0,4)=0
Step 2: Use the recursion for i ≥ 1: f(i, 0) = f(i-1, 1) and f(i, j) = f(i-1, f(i, j-1)) for 1 ≤ j ≤ 4
Step 8: Observe that for all i ≥ 5, f(i,2) stabilizes to 1, hence f(2015,2)=1

2. When i ≥ 1 and j = 0, f(i, 0) = f(i - 1, 1). So to get f(i, 0), we look at the previous i level, but with j=1.

3. When i ≥ 1 and 1 ≤ j ≤ 4, f(i, j) = f(i - 1, f(i, j - 1)). This is a recursive definition where to compute f(i, j), we need to compute f(i, j - 1) first, then use that result as the second argument to f(i - 1, ...).
